data.enText: a sudden feeling of great fear that cannot be controlled and prevents you from thinking clearly
a moment of panic
They were in a state of panic.

data.chText: 火势起来时，办公室人员惊慌逃出。
data.enText: Office workers fled in panic as the fire took hold.

data.chText: 对考试惊惶失措是没有用的。
data.enText: There's no point getting into a panic about the exams.
a panic attack (= a condition in which you suddenly feel very anxious, causing your heart to beat faster, etc.)
a panic decision (= one that is made when you are in a state of panic )

data.chText: 人心惶惶的局面；惶恐不安
data.enText: a situation in which people are made to feel very anxious, causing them to act quickly and without thinking carefully

data.chText: 亏损的消息令投资者人心惶惶。
data.enText: News of the losses caused (a) panic among investors.

data.chText: 现在精心规划，就会避免事到临头手忙脚乱。
data.enText: Careful planning at this stage will help to avoid a last-minute panic.

data.chText: 不用着急，我们有的是时间。
data.enText: There's no panic (= we do not need to rush) , we've got plenty of time.
panic buying/selling (= the act of buying/selling things quickly and without thinking carefully because you are afraid that a particular situation will become worse)
panic stations

data.chText: 慌乱的状态；（尤指）忙乱的状况
data.enText: a situation in which people feel anxious and there is a lot of confused activity, especially because there is a lot to do in a short period of time
to suddenly feel frightened so that you cannot think clearly and you say or do sth stupid, dangerous, etc.; to make sb do this

data.chText: 我看见发动机冒烟时，吓得手足无措。
data.enText: I panicked when I saw smoke coming out of the engine.
The gunfire panicked the horses.
panic sb into doing sth

data.chText: 使仓惶行事；使仓促行动
data.enText: to make sb act too quickly because they are afraid of sth

ex.chText: 没人知道她为什么惊慌地逃走了。
ex.enText: No one knows why she fled in panic.

ex.chText: 他发现无法按期完成任务，慌了起来。
ex.enText: He got into a panic when he realised that he couldn't meet the deadline.

synonyms.bx: 指突然产生的强烈的害怕或紧张之感，使人无法理智地思考和行动。

ex.chText: 对于食品污染的增多，人们越来越恐惧。
ex.enText: There is growing alarm at the increase in food contamination.

synonyms.bx: 指因意识到可能发生的坏事或危险而产生的惊恐或担忧之感。

ex.chText: 她看到一条大蛇时吓得往后退。
ex.enText: She recoiled with horror when she saw a big snake.

ex.chText: 他发现外套上沾有血迹，大为惊恐。
ex.enText: To his horror, he realized there were blood stains on his coat.

synonyms.bx: 指非常强烈的震惊或恐惧之感，含有厌恶的意味。

ex.chText: 几颗炸弹接二连三地爆炸，她害怕地尖叫起来。
ex.enText: Several bombs went off one after another, and she screamed in terror.

ex.chText: 听到枪响，孩子们胆战心惊。
ex.enText: The sound of gun shots struck terror into the children's hearts.

synonyms.bx: 强调极度的恐惧，语义最强。

data.enText: panic stations

data.chText: 慌乱的状态；（尤指）忙乱的状况
data.enText: a situation in which people feel anxious and there is a lot of confused activity, especially because there is a lot to do in a short period of time
panic sb into doing sth

data.chText: 使仓惶行事；使仓促行动
data.enText: to make sb act too quickly because they are afraid of sth

tr: an overwhelming feeling of fear and anxiety
sudden mass fear and anxiety over anticipated events
example: a bomb scare led them to evacuate the building

tr: cause sudden fear in or fill with sudden panic
example: The mere thought of an isolation cell panicked the prisoners

tr: be overcome by a sudden fear
example: The students panicked when told that final exams were less than a week away

value.def: Panic is a very strong feeling of anxiety or fear, which makes you act without thinking carefully.

example.ex: An earthquake hit the capital, causing panic among the population...
example.tran: 首都发生了地震，引发民众恐慌。

example.ex: I phoned the doctor in a panic, crying that I'd lost the baby.
example.tran: 我惊慌失措地给医生打电话，哭着说我的孩子没了。

value.def: Panic or a panic is a situation in which people are affected by a strong feeling of anxiety.

example.ex: There was a moment of panic in Britain as it became clear just how vulnerable the nation was...
example.tran: 一时间，英国出现了大恐慌，因为人们清楚地看到了英国有多么不堪一击。

example.ex: I'm in a panic about getting everything done in time...
example.tran: 我一阵手忙脚乱，想及时做完所有事情。

example.ex: The policy announcement caused panic buying of petrol.
example.tran: 那则政策公告引发了汽油抢购风潮。

value.tran: 恐慌局面；人心惶惶的状态

value.def: If you panic or if someone panics you, you suddenly feel anxious or afraid, and act quickly and without thinking carefully.

example.ex: Guests panicked and screamed when the bomb exploded...
example.tran: 炸弹爆炸后，客人们惊慌失措，尖声惊叫。

example.ex: The unexpected and sudden memory briefly panicked her...
example.tran: 突然间莫名涌起的回忆让她心头一紧。

example.ex: She refused to be panicked into a hasty marriage.
example.tran: 她不愿因恐慌而仓促结婚。

trans: 恐慌障碍；急性焦虑症；惊恐障碍；惊恐病；恐慌症
惊慌；惊慌地；恐慌；惊恐地；惊慌失措地
